dt: {bc}to smear or rub with oil or an oily substance
{bc}to apply oil to as part of a religious ceremony
{bc}to choose by or as if by divine election
{bc}to designate as if by a ritual {a_link|anointment}

dt.t: Critics have {wi}anointed{/wi} her as an important new literary figure.

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French {it}enoint{/it}, past participle of {it}enoindre{/it}, from Latin {it}inunguere{/it}, from {it}in-{/it} + {it}unguere{/it} to smear {ma}{mat|ointment|}{/ma}
shortdef: to smear or rub with oil or an oily substance
to apply oil to as part of a religious ceremony
to choose by or as if by divine election; also : to designate as if by a ritual anointment

dt: {bc}chosen or designated by oneself {bc}{d_link|anointed|anoint} by oneself

dt.t: Colorado's radio airwaves most weekend mornings teem with {wi}self-anointed{/wi} financial experts telling you how to manage your money, when, in fact, some of them have had problems managing their own.

shortdef: chosen or designated by oneself : anointed by oneself
